body_html:
@ezyang
There's a difference

$ cat /tmp/getenv.cpp
#include <iostream>
#include <cstdlib>

int main()
{
    if(const char* env_p = std::getenv("ATEN_DISABLE_AVX2"))
        std::cout << "Your ATEN_DISABLE_AVX2 is: " << env_p << '\n';
}
$ export ATEN_DISABLE_AVX2=
$ g++ /tmp/getenv.cpp && ./a.out
Your ATEN_DISABLE_AVX2 is:
$ unset ATEN_DISABLE_AVX2
$ g++ /tmp/getenv.cpp && ./a.out
$

We check for the presence of this env variable and not it's value, so this is an important distinction.
